description: Numbers n such that the trinomial x^n + x + 1 is irreducible over GF(5).
comments: No other n < 4400. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 12 2007Next term > 10^4. [_Joerg Arndt_, Mar 02 2016]
mathematica: Do[ If[ ToString[ Factor[ x^n + x^1 + 1, Modulus -> 5] ] == ToString[ x^n + x^1 + 1], Print[n] ], {n, 0, 750} ]
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = polisirreducible(Mod(1, 5)*(x^n + x + 1)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 11 2014(Sage)P.<x> = GF(5)[]for n in xrange(0, 10000):       if (x^n+x+1).is_irreducible():           print(n)# _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 02 2016
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 13 2000
extensions: a(1) and a(2) from _Eric M. Schmidt_, Feb 10 2014
a(22) and a(23) from _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 02 2016
